p:
In the end, no matter how many cans you recycle or how much you shorten your shower, our systems and institutions will continue to warm the planet and pollute the oceans without legislative mandates. Bill McKibben, author and founder of the worldwide 350 climate movement, writes:
We don’t have time for incremental, individual changes. Time is just a physical constraint that we’re dealing with. And so the most important things an individual can do is be less of an individual. Join together with other people in movements large enough to affect changes in policy and economics that might actually move the system enough to matter (Hagan 2019).
